p: Also other studies have shown these two factors to be powerful explanatory factors for adaptation to climate change [ 10â€“ 11]. The strength of belief in local effects of climate change provides an explanation to the variation in Swedish municipality planners' implementation of measures for adaptation to climate change as well [ 12]. In the case of understanding which values are most at risk, past research has found people who particularly value culture, identity, community cohesion and sense of place are less likely to perceive themselves at risk of climate change e.g. [ 13].
